name: Landlord Intends to Live in Property
short_description: Landlord intends to live in property as only or principal home

intention.purpose: To occupy as only or principal home
intention.timing: Genuine intention at time of tribunal hearing

evidence_required: Evidence of need (selling current home, job relocation)
red_flags: History of using ground without occupying
tenant_defenses: Landlord's past conduct suggests false intention
notes: Tribunal has full discretion. Must prove genuine intention at hearing. Cannot re-let within 3 months or face penalties.

re_letting_penalty.prohibition: Cannot market or let property within 3 months
exceptions: Landlord sells to someone who occupies
re_letting_penalty.penalty: Up to 6 months' rent payable to former tenant if breached

case_law: Lothian and Borders Fire Board v Dundas [2019] - Genuine intention required
tribunal_considerations: Why does landlord need this property?
